qas.question: Who took over after the preliminary phase?
Why did Professor Skousen gather fragments and have them analyzed?
What process what used to study the gathered fragments?
On what did Skousen analyze ink and pencil remnants?
What year was the final phase of the project completed?

plausible_answers.text: editor and head of the FARMS

qas.question: Professor Skousen left what position in 1988?
Who sold the community of christ church?
What did Skousen delete ink and pencil remnants from?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>1988<b5_0/><a0_0/>, with that preliminary phase of the project completed, <a1_0>Professor Skousen<a1_0/> took over as <b6_0>editor and head of the FARMS<b6_0/> Critical Text of the Book of Mormon Project and proceeded to gather still scattered fragments of the Original Manuscript of the Book of Mormon and to have <a3_0>advanced photographic techniques<a3_0/> applied <a2_0>to obtain fine readings<a2_0/> from otherwise unreadable pages and fragments. He also closely examined the <a4_0><b8_0>Printer’s Manuscript<b8_0/><a4_0/> (owned by the Community of Christ—<b7_0>RLDS Church<b7_0/> in Independence, Missouri) for differences in types of ink or pencil, in order to determine when and by whom they were made. He also collated the various editions of the Book of Mormon down to the present to see what sorts of changes have been made through time.
